components.description: A large plus / addition symbol, as used in mathematics.
components.title: Heavy Plus Sign

description: A large plus / addition symbol, as used in mathematics.
title: Heavy Plus Sign

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Dingbats -> Heavy variants of arithmetic symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: Heavy Plus Sign was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015. Copy and paste this emoji: Copy http://emojipedia.org/heavy-plus-sign/
emoji_net_data.name: heavy plus sign

bn:13669947v: To add; to subject to addition.

bn:00082317v: To combine more than one item into one; to put together.
Make an addition (to); join or combine or unite with others; increase the quality, quantity, size or scope of

To join or unite, as one thing to another, or as several particulars, so as to increase the number, augment the quantity or enlarge the magnitude, or so as to form into one aggregate. Hence: To sum up; to put together mentally.

To join or unite, as one thing to another, or as several particulars, so as to increase the number, augment the quantity, enlarge the magnitude, or so as to form into one aggregate; to sum up; to put together mentally, as, to add numbers; to add up a column.
To join or combine thereby increasing the quantity or size of something.

bn:00001296n: The mathematical operation of combining or adding two numbers to obtain an equal simple amount or total
(arithmetic) the mathematical operation of increasing one amount by another. The result of adding two quantities is their sum.
Addition is a mathematical operation that represents the total amount of objects together in a collection.
The arithmetic operation of summing; calculating the sum of two or more numbers
Sum of the previous one and the following one.
Summation is the operation of adding a sequence of numbers; the result is their sum or total.
